title: Social Login Integration
description: Add Google and Apple sign-in buttons to the login screen with OAuth flow handling and account linking.
instructions:
Implement social login functionality:

1. Add Google Sign-In button with proper branding
2. Add Apple Sign-In button (iOS only, or web)
3. Implement OAuth flow for each provider
4. Handle account linking when email already exists
5. Store social auth tokens securely
6. Update auth state after successful social login
7. Handle cancellation and errors gracefully

hints.text: Use google_sign_in and sign_in_with_apple packages for OAuth flows
Apple Sign-In requires configuration in Xcode and Apple Developer Portal
Handle account linking by first verifying the email/password, then linking the social provider

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling the case where user cancels social sign-in
commonMistakes.consequence: App shows error instead of gracefully returning to login
commonMistakes.correction: Check for null return from Google Sign-In and AuthorizationErrorCode.canceled from Apple

commonMistakes.mistake: Storing social tokens in regular SharedPreferences
commonMistakes.consequence: Tokens could be extracted from device, compromising security
commonMistakes.correction: Always use flutter_secure_storage for any authentication tokens
